question.text: Which of these statements about <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>[</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mo>)</mo><mn>6</mn></msub><msup><mo>]</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>-</mo></mrow></msup></math> is true

options.text: <math><mo>[</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>-</mo></mrow></msup></math> has four unpaired electrons and will be in a low-spin configuration.

<math><mo>[</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>-</mo></mrow></msup></math> has four unpaired electrons and will be in a high-spin configuration.

<math><mo>[</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>-</mo></mrow></msup></math> has no unpaired electrons and will be in a high-spin configuration.

<math><mo>[</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><msub><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>-</mo></mrow></msup></math> has no unpaired electrons and will be in a low-spin configuration.

solution.text:
In [Co(CN)6]3- Cobalt is in + 3 oxidation state so Co+3=(Ar)3d64s04p0
As in presence of strong field ligand, pairing of electrons occurs so in this complex no unpaired electron is present and it is a low-spin complex.
